benchmark_details.name: WebWalkerQA
benchmark_details.overview: WebWalkerQA is designed to assess the ability of Large Language Models (LLMs) to perform web traversal by evaluating their capacity to systematically extract high-quality data from a websiteâ€™s subpages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs' web traversal abilities in complex, multi-step information-seeking tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The current dataset comprises 680 high-quality QA pairs, which is limited compared to some existing benchmarks.

data.source: 680 question-answer pairs collected from various official websites across different domains.
data.annotation: Combines initial LLM-based annotations followed by human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the evaluation of the correctness of answers against the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates a better ability of LLMs to perform web traversal and extract information.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing LLMs achieved accuracies below 40% in web traversal tasks.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated through both quantitative and qualitative metrics.
